content: little hugger by barbara hurd years ago i make a thick textured buttoned cowl named promenade cowl it has always been a favorite of mine due to its versatility you could wear it buttoned up for high warmth or partially buttoned for style and slight warmth recently i spun some gorgeous 2-ply yarn with subtly blended colors that screamed delicate detailed and couture remembering my love for promenade cowl i created the little sister… little hugger it ll give you a gentle hug abundant warmth and the perfect detail to complete your look and just where you need it peeking out from under the collar of your coat be sure to make it in a complimentary color for your eyes size cowl fits snugly and measures 15 by 5 5 inches blocked remember the bottom may be left open to hang down slightly with the cute split when all 3 buttons are closed it rides up and just covers your neck to make larger adjust gauge or cast on extra sts in the garter bands remembering that they overlap so only count half the extra added on buttons can also be adjusted in placement on the bands to add/decrease width slightly for custom fit yarn i used a homespun 2-ply that gave me 4 sts per inch softly a light worsted of your choice that gets gauge would work needle circular us 5 gauge very important in a snug garment or it may not fit at all 16 sts/4 inches in stockinette this gauge changes to 19 5/4 inches in pattern buttons 3 size 13mm or size you like that fits the holes and stays closed i used 2 buttons and opted for none at the bottom because i found them in my button box and loved them but only found 2 markers 2 or more depending on personal preference terms k= knit p= purl sk2p= slip 1 st k 2 together pass slipped stitch over combined st y/o= yarn over 3/3 cable= see below pattern cable place 3 sts on cable needle and hold to front knit 3 sts then knit 3 sts from cable needle buttonholes there are 3 buttonholes you can omit the bottom one if only using 2 buttons they are placed 1 inch from the start 2 75 inches from start and 4 5 inches from start remember you are starting at the bottom of the cowl so that first made buttonhole can be skipped on the right side you will k4 and pass the 3rd st over the 4th and k the 5th lc lace cable pattern row 1 *k6 p2 k1 y/o k3 sk2p k3 y/o k1 p2 repeat to 2nd marker row 2 4 6 8 *k2 p11 k2 p6 repeat to 2nd marker row 3 *k6 p2 k2 y/o k2 sk2p k2 y/o k2 p2 repeat as before row 5 *k6 p2 k3 y/o k1 sk2p k1 y/o k3 p2 row 7 make buttonhole on this row and then every 1
